text: Jean-Philippe Rameau (born Dijon, September ? 1683; died Paris, 12 September 1764) was a French composer. He is famous for his music for harpsichord and for his operas. His most well-known operas are: Hippolyte et Aricie, Castor et Pollux, and Dardanus. He is also known for his one act opera "Pigmalion" which he is said to have composed in 8 days. He is also known as an important music theorist by writing many books on the matter. == Other websites == * Jean- Philippe Rameau / Discography Category:1683 births Category:1764 deaths Category:18th-century French composers Category:Baroque composers Category:Music theorists
title: Jean-Philippe Rameau
